sourceDesc:
<<<<<<< HEAD
Divine meditations. Written by an honourable person. Whereto is adjoyned, a determination of the question, whether men ought to kneele at the receipt of the Holy Communion. And an essay of friendship Wake, Isaac, Sir, 1580?-1632.
[2], 162, [4] p.
printed by T. Badger, for Humphrey Mosley, and are to be sold at his shop at his shop at the Princes Armes, in S. Pauls Church-Yard, London : 1641.
An honourable person = Sir Isaac Wake. With marginal notes. With a final imprimatur leaf: Imprimatur. Tho. Wykes. R.P. Episc. Lond. Capell: Domest. "An essay of friendship." has a separate title page dated 1640; register and pagination continuous. Copy has print show-through. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======
